channel.title: Groundhog
channel.description: a Grasshopper plugin and wiki exploring the applications of computational design in landscape architecture.

item.title: Flows (documentation)
item.description: Components for creating simple projections and analysis of surface water flows.

item.title: Plants (documentation)
item.description: Components that enable the parametric control of plant selection, distribution, performance, and visualisation.

item.title: Terrain (documentation)
item.description: Components for quantifying different elements of topographic form.

item.title: Analogue Computation (techniques)
item.description: A different approach to biomimicry â€” using digital and analogue methods to better understand natural phenomena.

item.title: Field Conditions (techniques)
item.description: 'The complexity of the given' as a compositional strategy in mapping and design.

item.title: Keio University Roof Garden (projects)
item.description: A contemporary rooftop garden that uses a tiled field to recreate natural planting patterns.

item.title: MAX IV Laboratory Landscape (projects)
item.description: A defensive topography that creates an intricate series of rolling mounds to dampen vibrations from a nearby highway.

item.title: Botanic Gardens of Barcelona (projects)
item.description: Facets form a mosaic that stretches across a steep slope and structures a tailored planting plan.

item.title: South Park (projects)
item.description: Computational tools testing the resilience of analogue rules
